close up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if a shop or building closes up or is closed up, it stops being open to the public for a period of time
close up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The resorts are all closed up for the season.
close up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to stop doing something for a period of time or permanently
close up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: When it rains, there is no alternative but to close up shop.
close up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a group of people close up, they move closer together
close up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: if a wound closes up or if someone closes it up, the edges grow together again or are sewn together
close up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The scar is closing up nicely – it’ll soon be time to take the stitches out.
close up.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to become narrower or to shut
close up.translation[0].definitions[4].e: The flowers close up at night.
Occasionally the channel widened then closed up tight again.
close up.translation[0].definitions[5].d: to refuse to talk to someone about something
close up.translation[0].definitions[5].e: The moment I said I was a police officer, everyone would close up like a clam.
close up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a photograph or part of a film in which the camera seems to have been very close to the picture it took
close up.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Much of the movie is shot in close-up.
